snippet: Friends and those who knew him remembered Junior Seau, whose death was ruled a suicide Thursday, from a teenager to an N.F.L. star to his days after his career ended.
abstract: Friends and acquaintances of Junior Seau, former NFL linebacker who committed suicide, create makeshift memorial outside his home in Oceanside, Calif. Photo (M)

byline.original: By GREG BISHOP and MARY PILON; Greg Bishop reported from Oceanside, Calif., and Mary Pilon from New York

lead_paragraph: OCEANSIDE, Calif. -- Last Sunday, three days before Junior Seau was found dead in his oceanfront home, he spoke at the memorial service for his mailman. The theme of his speech, according to those in attendance: to celebrate life. Seau's ended Wednesday morning. The San Diego medical examiner's office ruled Thursday that Seau's death was a suicide from a gunshot wound to the chest. He was 43.

headline.main: A Community Recalls a Star Who Never Left
